page.title: 14THE USE OF CHESTNUT POLES
page.content: The use of chestnut poles for hoops for barrels is declining. Cowdray chestnut is used for{"paling"}that is fencing and for walking-sticks. When the poles are cut, they are peeled and cleared, falling naturally into triangular stakes. These are strung on to wire to make{"pale" {fencing.} Poles of a suitable thickness are chosen for{walking {sticks,}and the lower part of the first year's growth is selected because it is thicker and tougher at the base. The process of making a walking stick involves:- {1) Peeling after seasoning {2) Sanding and washing {3) Forming of the crook handle {4) Trimming for length {5) Straightening {6) Polishing, varnishing and oiling {7) Fixing of ferrule.
